definition: to see through the world of mortals (idiom, of Buddhist monk)/disillusioned with human society/to reject the world for a monastic life
to see/to look at/to read/to watch/to visit/to call on/to consider/to regard as/to look after/to treat (an illness)/to depend on/to feel (that)/(after verb) to give it a try/Watch out! (for a danger)
to look after/to take care of/to watch/to guard
broken/damaged/worn out/lousy/rotten/to break, split or cleave/to get rid of/to destroy/to break with/to defeat/to capture (a city etc)/to expose the truth of

sentences.english: Without love a person could go hayward and also become cruel and ferocious.
sentences.chinese: 没有爱一个人会看破红尘也会变得凶狠残忍。

sentences.english: He has died to worldly matters and become a Buddhist monk.
sentences.chinese: 他已看破红尘，出家当和尚了。

sentences.english: The giving up of eating shows that they are so unattached to this world that they can choose to give up food.
sentences.chinese: 绝食表明他们看破红尘，以至于选择放弃进食。

sentences.english: Or Kanpo Red Dust, games market conditions, a woman Henhen the kind of men.
sentences.chinese: 或者看破红尘，游戏情场，成为女人恨恨的那种男人。

sentences.english: Possibly, be cynical , play feeling becomes that woman regret man.
sentences.chinese: 或者看破红尘，游戏情场，成为女人恨恨的那种男人。

sentences.english: See through Red Dust, for ages, but also what?
sentences.chinese: 看破红尘，望穿秋水，又能怎样？

definition: to take refuge in religious life
to achieve supreme enlightenment or nirvana (Buddhism)
to leave home (to become a Buddhist monk or nun)
to be at peace with oneself
to regard as unimportant/to be indifferent to (fame, wealth etc)/(of an economy or a market) to slacken
to return to normal life (leaving a monastic order)
world-weary/pessimistic
not to become attached to material things, not to pity oneself

definition: to come to accept an unpleasant fact/to get over sth/to cheer up
to engage with secular society/to involve oneself in human affairs/to join the WTO (abbr. for 加入世界貿易組織|加入世界贸易组织[jia1 ru4 Shi4 jie4 Mao4 yi4 Zu3 zhi1])
to stand aloof from worldly affairs
fully aware/to recognize fully
to go back to one's native place and live in seclusion
monk/nun (Buddhist or Daoist)
to become a Buddha/to attain enlightenment
living a simple life
